alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:51PM EST until January 26 at 9:46AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Forsyth and Fulton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will be flooded. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around two feet of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 7.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.2 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM EST.
